description: Sets the default active listeners for all subsequent game objects that are registered. See <tt>AK::SoundEngine::SetDefaultListeners</tt>.

examples.description: Sets the "emitter"'s "obstructionLevel" and "occlusionLevel" for the "listener".

description: Unregisters a game object. Registering a game object twice does nothing. Unregistering it once unregisters it no matter how many times it has been registered. Unregistering a game object while it is in use is allowed, but the control over the parameters of this game object is lost. For example, say a sound associated with this game object is a 3D moving sound. It stops moving when the game object is unregistered, and there is no way to regain control over the game object. See <tt>AK::SoundEngine::UnregisterGameObj</tt>.

gameObject.description: ID of the game object to be unregistered. Valid range is [0, 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFDF]. Use \c AK_INVALID_GAME_OBJECT to unregister all game objects.

External Sources are a special type of source that you can put in a sound object in Wwise. It indicates that the real sound data will be provided at runtime. While external source conversion can be triggered by SoundBank generation, this operation can be used to process sources not contained in the Wwise Project. Refer to \ref integrating_external_sources.

description: Creates Wwise objects and imports audio files. This function does not return an error when something fails during the import process, please refer to the log for the result of each import command. This function uses the same importation processor available through the Tab Delimited import in the Audio File Importer. The function returns an array of all objects created, replaced or re-used. Use the options to specify how the objects are returned. For more information, refer to \ref waapi_import.

default.description: Default values for each item in "imports". Use this object to avoid repeating common properties of every imported element.

importLanguage.description: Imports the language for the audio file import (taken from the project's defined languages, found in the WPROJ file LanguageList).

importLocation.description: Object ID (GUID), name, or path used as root relative object paths.

audioFile.description: Path to media file to import. This path must be accessible from Wwise. For using WAAPI on Mac, please refer to \ref waapi_path_on_mac .

audioFileBase64.description: Base64 encoded WAV audio file data to import with its target file path relative to the Originals folder, separated by a vertical bar. E.g. 'MySound.wav|UklGRu...'.

objectPath.description: The path and name of the object(s) to be created. The path uses backslashes and can either be absolute or relative. Object types can be specified before the name. For example: \verbatim \\Actor-Mixer

objectType.description: Specifies the type of object to create when importing an audio file. This type can also be specified directly in the objectPath. Refer to \ref wobjects_index for the available types.

notes.description: The "Notes" field of the created object.

audioSourceNotes.description: The "Notes" field of the created audio source object.

dialogueEvent.description: Defines the path and name of a Dialogue Event to be created for the imported object. Refer to Tab Delimited Import in the Wwise Help documentation for more information.

autoAddToSourceControl.description: Determines if Wwise automatically performs a source control Add operation on the imported files. Defaults to true.

autoCheckOutToSourceControl.description: Determines if Wwise automatically performs a source control Checkout operation (when applicable) on the modified files. Defaults to true.

files.description: The list of imported original files.

description: Gets the min/max peak pairs, in the given region of an audio source, as a collection of binary strings (one per channel). The strings are base-64 encoded, 16-bit signed int arrays, with min and max values being interleaved. If getCrossChannelPeaks is true, only one binary string represents the peaks across all channels globally.

object.description: The ID (GUID), name, or path of the audio source object.

timeFrom.description: The start time, in seconds, of the section of the audio source for which peaks are required. This number must be smaller than timeTo.

timeTo.description: The end time, in seconds, of the section of the audio source for which peaks are required. This number must be larger than timeFrom.

numPeaks.description: The number of peaks that are required (minimum 1).

getCrossChannelPeaks.description: When true, peaks are calculated globally across channels, instead of per channel.

numChannels.description: The number of channels of peak data (i.e. the number of strings in peaksBinaryStrings). This is 1 if getCrossChannelPeaks is true.

maxAbsValue.description: The maximum value that a peak can take. This can be used to normalize the peaks in the array (between -1, 1), by dividing each by this number.

peaksArrayLength.description: The number of peaks in the returned min max channel arrays. If peaksArrayLength is less than the numPeaks input argument, this indicates fewer samples were available than numPeaks requested. In this c

peaksDataSize.description: The size of the data in the peaks min max arrays. This can be used (in conjunction with peaksArrayLength) to decode the peaksBinaryStrings to 16 bit integer arrays

examples.title: Getting peaks per channel
examples.description: Get peaks for an audio source object.

examples.title: Getting peaks across channels
examples.description: Get peaks for an audio source object.

description: Gets the min/max peak pairs in the entire trimmed region of an audio source, for each channel, as an array of binary strings (one per channel). The strings are base-64 encoded, 16-bit signed int arrays, with min and max values being interleaved. If getCrossChannelPeaks is true, there is only one binary string representing peaks across all channels globally.

object.description: The ID (GUID), name, or path of the audio source.

numPeaks.description: The number of peaks that are required (minimum 1).

getCrossChannelPeaks.description: When true, peaks are calculated globally across channels, instead of per channel.

numChannels.description: The number of channels of peak data (i.e. the number of strings in peaksBinaryStrings). This is 1 if getCrossChannelPeaks is true.

maxAbsValue.description: The maximum value that a peak can take. This can be used to normalize the peaks in the array (between -1, 1), by dividing each by this number.

peaksArrayLength.description: The number of peaks in the returned min max channel arrays. If peaksArrayLength is less than the numPeaks input argument, this indicates fewer samples were available than numPeaks requested. In this c

peaksDataSize.description: The size of the data in the min/max peaks arrays. This can be used (in conjunction with peaksArrayLength) to decode the peaksBinaryStrings to 16 bit integer arrays

examples.title: Getting peaks per channel
examples.description: Gets peaks for an audio source object (within the trimmed region).

examples.description: Gets peaks for an audio source object (within the trimmed region).

description: Execute a Lua script. Optionally, specify additional Lua search paths, additional modules, and additional Lua scripts to load prior to the main script. The script can return a value. All arguments will be passed to the Lua script in the "wa_args" global variable.

doFiles.description: Defines additional Lua files to load before the main Lua script is loaded and executed. It is also possible to specify a directory in which all Lua files will be loaded.

return.description: Result returned by the Lua script. Use a return statement at the end of the script.

description: Copies an object to the given parent. Note that if a Work Unit is copied, the operation cannot be undone and the project will be saved.

description: Creates an object of type 'type', as a child of 'parent'. Refer to \ref waapi_import for more information about creating objects. Also refer to \ref ak_wwise_core_audio_import to import audio files to Wwise. To create Effect or Source plug-ins, use \ref ak_wwise_core_object_set, and refer to \ref wobjects_index for the classId.

platform.description: The ID (GUID) or unique name of the platform used when setting properties via this command. Not specifying a platform sets the value for all linked platforms.

autoAddToSourceControl.description: Determines if Wwise automatically performs an Add source control operation for affected work units. Defaults to true.

description: Performs a query and returns the data, as specified in the options, for each object in the query result. The query can specify either a 'waql' argument or a 'from' argument with an optional 'transform' argument. Refer to \ref waql_introduction or \ref waapi_query for more information. Refer to \ref waapi_query_return to learn about options.

waql.description: Specifies a query in the WAQL language. Refer to \ref waql_introduction for more information.

from.description: The query starting point. Note, this is deprecated. The WAQL argument should be used instead.

transform.description: Array of sequential transformations chained on the object list returned by "from".

return.description: An array of objects found, with properties matching what was supplied in the options.

description: Pastes properties, references and lists from one object to any number of target objects. Only those properties, references and lists which differ between source and target are pasted. Refer to \ref wobjects_index for more information on the properties, references and lists available on each object type.

source.description: The ID (GUID), name, or path of the source object.

targets.description: Array of target objects to paste into.

pasteMode.description: Paste mode for lists. Default value is "replaceEntire". With "replaceEntire" all elements in the lists of a target object are removed and all selected elements from the source's lists are copied. Conv

inclusion.description: Array of properties, references and lists to include in the paste operation. When not specified, all properties, references and lists are included, and the exclusion defines which ones to exclude

exclusion.description: Array of properties, references and lists to exclude from the paste operation. When not specified, no properties, references and lists are excluded.

examples.title: Pasting with defaults
examples.description: Paste the property, reference and list differences from the source object to the target object. All differences will be pasted.

examples.title: Pasting with inclusion

examples.description: Paste the property, reference and list differences from the source object to the target objects. Select a non-default paste mode for the lists and paste everything except for the "Volume" property and "RTPC" list.

examples.title: Pasting a list
examples.description: Paste the property, reference and list differences from the source object to the target objects. Only the selected "RTPC" list will be pasted, no property or reference differences will be pasted.

examples.title: Pasting a list and all properties and references
examples.description: Paste the property, reference and list differences from the source object to the target objects. Only the "RTPC" list will be pasted along with all properties and references. The source object only has "RTPC" and "Metadata" lists.

examples.title: Pasting a property and all lists
examples.description: Paste the property, reference and list differences from the source object to the target objects. Only the "Volume" property will be pasted along with all lists for the source object. The source object only has "RTPC" and "Metadata" lists.

description: Allows for batch processing of the following operations: Object creation in a child hierarchy, Object creation in a list, Setting name, notes, properties and references. Refer to \ref waapi_import for more information about creating objects. Also refer to \ref ak_wwise_core_audio_import to import audio files to Wwise.

objects.description: An array of objects on which to set values and create child or list objects.

platform.description: Unless overriden by an individual "object", the ID (GUID) or unique name of the platform used when setting properties and references via this operation. Not specifying a platform sets the value for al

onNameConflict.description: Unless overriden by an individual "object", the action to take if "object" already has a child with the same name. Default value is "fail". Refer to \ref waapi_create_objects_modes for more informatio

listMode.description: Unless overriden by an individual "object", the action to take if "object" already has objects in a specified list. Default value is "append". Refer to \ref waapi_set_lists_modes for more information.

autoAddToSourceControl.description: Determines if Wwise automatically performs an Add source control operation for affected work units. Defaults to true.

objects.description: Array of {object, created objects} associations for each parent object.

examples.title: Creating multiple child hierarchies of objects in batch
examples.description: In one operation, create child hierarchies under multiple objects: #1. Creates a new Sound object called 'Boom' under the specified parent, #2. Creates a new virtual folder called 'Guns' under the default work unit. If a folder with the same name already exists, it automatically finds a unique name, #3. Creates an event called 'Play_SFX' under the virtual folder 'WAAPI', with Play action on the SFX sound object, #4. Creates a Random Container called 'Boom' under the specified parent, with two Sound objects 'A' and 'B', #5. Creates a Custom Cue inside an existing Music Segment with the specified name and time in milliseconds. See the examples for \ref ak_wwise_core_object_create to compare the two schemas.

examples.title: Creating a music hierarchy
examples.description: In one operation, create a Music Switch Container, a Music Playlist Container, a Music Segment, and a Music Track with one imported WAV file.

examples.title: Importing a WAV file into a new Sound SFX and creating the associated Event
examples.description: Creates a new Sound object, imports a WAV file into it, and then creates an Event with a Play action on the Sound.

examples.title: Adding an RTPC with curve to an object
examples.description: In an object's "RTPC" list, this function creates an RTPC on a property using the specified <tt>ControlInput</tt> and curve points. The <tt>ControlInput</tt> is the game parameter, Modulator, or MIDI object assigned to the x axis of the RTPC. If you use a game parameter, you are passing a reference, and therefore the game parameter that you want to link to <tt>ControlInput</tt> must be created before you pass it to the parameter.

examples.title: Adding an RTPC with curve to an object and creates a new Custom ControlInput
examples.description: In the "RTPC" list of an object, creates an RTPC on a property using the given ControlInput and curve points.

examples.title: Setting an effect plug-in
examples.description: Sets the effects of a Sound to a newly created Custom RoomVerb Effect plug-in.

examples.title: Creating new Source Plug-ins for a Voice
examples.description: Creates two new Source objects for a Voice using plug-in Silence and SoundSeed Grain for the languages "English(US)" and "French".

examples.title: Setting the "Curve" reference of an RTPC
examples.description: Sets the curve points of a specified RTPC.

examples.title: Setting the values of the name, notes, a property and a reference
examples.description: Setting the name, notes, "Volume" property and "OutputBus" reference of the object defined by "object" . See the examples for \ref ak_wwise_core_object_setname , \ref ak_wwise_core_object_setnotes , \ref ak_wwise_core_object_setproperty and \ref ak_wwise_core_object_setreference to compare the two schemas.

examples.title: Importing a WAV file to create a Sound SFX object
examples.description: Creates a Source SFX object and an audio file source object and imports its wave file.

examples.title: Importing Base64 content to create a Sound SFX object
examples.description: Creates a Source SFX object and an audio file source object and imports the specified base64 content as a WAV file.

examples.title: Importing two WAV files to create two Sound SFX objects
examples.description: Creates two Sound SFX objects and two audio file source objects and imports their wave files.

examples.title: Importing a WAV file into a Sound Voice
examples.description: Creates a Sound Voice object and an audio file source object and imports its wave file for English localization.

examples.title: Importing a WAV file into an Audio File Source
examples.description: Creates a Sound SFX object and its audio source. The property field Sound object is also set.

examples.title: Importing a MIDI file into a Music Segment to create a Music Track
examples.description: Creates a Music Segment from the imported MIDI file. A Music Track and a Music Clip are also created.

examples.title: Importing two WAV files into a Music Segment to create two Music Tracks
examples.description: Creates a Music Segment, and imports two WAV files. Two new Music Tracks and two Music Clips are also created.

examples.title: Importing a WAV file into a Music Track to create a Music Clip
examples.description: Creates a Music Segment, a Music Track, and imports its WAV file. A Music Track is also created.

examples.title: Importing a WAV file into a Convolution Reverb effect plug-in
examples.description: Creates a Sound and a Convolution Reverb effect plug-in, then imports a WAV file as an impulse response.

examples.title: Importing WAV files into Impacter source plug-in
examples.description: Creates a Sound and an Impacter source plug-in, then imports WAV files.

examples.title: Importing a WAV file into Soundseed Grain source plug-in
examples.description: Creates a Sound and a Soundseed Grain source plug-in, then imports a WAV file.

examples.title: Changing the playlist of a Random Sequence object
examples.description: The playlist added to the Random Sequence object is composed of the '1st number' object followed by two times '2nd Number'.

examples.title: Setting the trigger of a MusicStinger.
examples.description: The object field contains the id of the MusicStinger we want to change.

examples.title: Adding a Marker to an Audio Source
examples.description: In the "Markers" list of an audio source, appends a Marker using the given Time and Label properties.

examples.title: Create a Music Playlist Container with segment and playlist

The returned data includes "Inclusive" and "Exclusive" values, where "Inclusive" refers to the time spent in the element plus the time spent in any called elements, and "Exclusive" values pertain to execution only within the element itself.

Connects the Wwise Authoring application to a Wwise Sound Engine running executable or to a saved profile file. The host must be running code with communication enabled. If only "host" is provided, Wwise connects to the first Sound Engine instance found. To distinguish between different instances, you can also provide the name of the application to connect to.

description: Converts the external sources files for the project as detailed in the wsources file, and places them into either the default folder, or the folder specified by the output argument. External Sources are a special type of source that you can put in a Sound object in Wwise. It indicates that the real sound data will be provided at run time. While External Source conversion is also triggered by SoundBank generation, this operation can be used to process sources not contained in the Wwise Project. Please refer to Wwise SDK help page "Integrating External Sources".

sources.description: An array of external sources files and corrisponding arguments.

description: Generate a list of SoundBanks with the import definition specified in the WAAPI request. If you do not write the SoundBanks to disk, subscribe to \ref ak_wwise_core_soundbank_generated to receive SoundBank structure info and the bank data as base64. Note: This is a synchronous operation.

soundbanks.description: List of user-defined SoundBanks to generate. If the array is empty then all user-defined SoundBanks are generated. Note that auto-defined SoundBanks cannot be specified, and all auto-defined SoundBank

platforms.description: List of platforms to generate. If you don't specify any platforms, all the platforms will be generated

languages.description: List of languages to generate. If you don't specify any languages, all the languages will be generated.

skipLanguages.description: By default, if you don't specify any languages all languages will be generated. If you set this parameter to true, no localized SoundBank will be generated.

rebuildSoundBanks.description: Will rebuild all SoundBanks if true. If you want to clear the converted media as well, use clearAudioFileCache parameter. Default value: false

writeToDisk.description: Use the normal SoundBank generation process and write the sound bank and info file to disk. Default value: false

rebuildInitBank.description: If you don't use rebuildSoundBanks, use this option to force a rebuild of the Init bank for each specified platform.

logs.description: The SoundBank generation log. The log is empty when used in WwiseConsole.

description: Change the source control provider and credentials. This is the same setting as the Source Control option in the Project Settings dialog in Wwise.

provider.description: Source control provider. Allowed values are Perforce, Subversion, any other source control supported or an empty string. An empty value is the equivalent of choosing No Control Source in the UI.

server.description: Server name or address. Default value is localhost.

port.description: Server port. This value is required for Perforce.

username.description: User name. This value is required for Perforce.

password.description: User password or ticket. This value is required for Perforce.

workspace.description: Workspace name. This value is required for Perforce.

host.description: Host name. This value is required for Perforce.

description: Assigns a Switch Container's child to a Switch. This is the equivalent of doing a drag&drop of the child to a state in the Assigned Objects view. The child is always added at the end for each state.

stateOrSwitch.description: The ID (GUID), name, or path of the State or Switch with which to assign. Must be the child of the Switch Group or State Group that is currently set for the Switch Container.

description: Begins an undo group. Make sure to call \ref ak_wwise_core_undo_endgroup exactly once for every ak.wwise.core.beginUndoGroup call you make. Calls to ak.wwise.core.undo.beginGroup can be nested. When closing a WAMP session, a check is made to ensure that all undo groups are closed. If not, a cancelGroup is called for each of the groups still open.

Enables debug assertions. Every call to enableAsserts with 'false' increments the ref count. Calling with true decrements the ref count. This is only available with Debug builds.

description: Enables or disables the automation mode for Wwise. This reduces the potential interruptions caused by message boxes and dialogs. For instance, enabling the automation mode silently accepts: project migration, project load log, EULA acceptance, project licence display and generic message boxes.

enable.description: When set to true, the automation mode reduces the blocking of dialogs and popups. When set to false, it reverts to the normal mode.

description: Generate a WAV file playing a tone with a simple envelope and save it to the specified location. This is provided as a utility to generate test WAV files.

path.description: File path to write the generated WAV file. This path normally uses the file extension WAV.

bitDepth.description: Bit depth of the audio file. Default is int16.

sampleRate.description: Sample rate of the audio file. Default is 48000

channelConfig.description: Channel configuration of the audio file. Default is 1.0. Please use the silence waveform for the ambisonics configurations, as the other tone signals will be incompatible with the format.

setAnonymous.description: Sets the channel configuration type to anonymous, this overrides the channel config but keeps the number of channels specified.

sustainTime.description: Number of seconds of the signal holds at the specified level. Default is 1 second.

sustainLevel.description: Decibel attenuation for the sustained signal. Default is 0 dB.

attackTime.description: Number of seconds for the signal to reach sustain level. Default is 0 second.

releaseTime.description: Number of seconds for the signal to release from sustain level. Default is 0 second.

waveformChannelMask.description: Specifies which channels receive waveform data. The channel mask is a bit field where each bit represents a channel. The least significant bit represents the channel at index zero. The bits with 0 are

examples.description: Generates a 1 second mono WAV file that contains a sine waveform, with a very short attack and release.

description: Captures a part of the Wwise UI relative to a view.

description: Execute a Lua script. Optionally, specify additional Lua search paths, additional modules, and additional Lua scripts to load prior to the main script. The script can return a value. All arguments will be passed to the Lua script in the "wa_args" global variable.

project.description: When no project is specified, no project is loaded. Refer to \ref ak_wwise_console_project_open for information on how to open a project.

lua-script.description: Specify the file path of the main Lua script to load and execute.

require.description: Specify an array of Lua module to load at runtime using the require system. This option must be followed by a Lua module name. The module name must be found in the Lua path. Ex: '--require debug.lua'

do-file.description: Specify an array of Lua files to load before the main Lua script is loaded and executed. This option must be followed by a absolute file name.

lua-path.description: Specify a search path for Lua modules loaded. This option must be followed by a Lua path. Ex: '--lua-path C:\\module\\?.lua'

result.description: Result returned by the Lua script

platforms.description: An array of platform. Each platform is an ID (GUID) or a unique name. Some commands can take platforms as arguments. Refer to the commands for more information.

value.description: A value to pass to the command. Some commands can take a value as an argument. Refer to the commands for more information.
